conclusion: Need to find the actual power P2 of lamp L2.
Voltage across L1 is 3V since it lights up normally.
Current through L1 is 1 A using P = V * I.
Resistance of L1 is 3 Ohms using R = V^2 / P.
EMF is generated by the moving conductor rod due to Lorentz force.
Total resistance in the circuit is r + R1 + R2.
Resistance of L2 is 6 Ohms using R = V^2 / P.
Total EMF is B * l * v.
Voltage across L2 is calculated from total EMF.
Power of L2 is calculated using P2 = V2 * I2.
